page.title: 13COMMUTING TO THE CAPITAL.
page.content:
With the advent of the new 125 trains the journey to the city is less of an ordeal. The journey to work now takes about 50 minutes and this improvement in accessibility has meant a number of implications for Wellingborough. Firstly, an increasing number of people have been able to commute to work daily. Secondly, although there are a number of obvious advantages with this shortening of distance there are also some problems. Trains are often overcrowded, a great inconvenience for businessmen who wish to work quietly on the train. Due to the increase in the use of
these trains land prices have steadily risen in Wellingborough, although these are comparitively cheap to the prices of the capital.
